text: As society starts deploying more solar and wind, we believe it should bring their LCOE even further down their cost curves, making the next batch of solar and wind even more affordable. If the LCOE falls, it could potentially unlock profitable new use cases for that electricity like desalinating water, removing CO2 from the atmosphere, or producing green hydrogen. Some experts in the field expect that the marginal cost of producing new electricity will actually approach zero. FHYE HIEQ MB2 HUSIUM UL WRISL HYoUXIS| $261Z0| ‘0'0ll £% 20I2t ol 4TI FHLITH
